longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: To constitute a Judicial Officers Recommendation Commission.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title
section.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Judicial Officers Recommendation Commission Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Ordinance, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: Chief Executive (行政長官) means the Chief Executive of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of the People’s Republic of China; (Added 121 of 1997 s. 2)
Commission (委員會) means the Judicial Officers Recommendation Commission established by this Ordinance; (Amended 79 of 1995 s. 50)
commissioner for oaths (監誓員) means a commissioner for oaths duly appointed by the Chief Justice under any enactment in force in Hong Kong; (Added 26 of 1997 s. 8)
judicial office (司法職位) means any judicial office specified in Schedule 1; (Amended 121 of 1997 s. 10)
judicial officer (司法人員) means the holder of a judicial office;
Legislative Council (立法會) means the Legislative Council but during the existence of the Provisional Legislative Council means the Provisional Legislative Council. (Added 121 of 1997 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: There is hereby established a Judicial Officers Recommendation Commission, which shall consist of— (Amended 79 of 1995 s. 50)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Justice, who shall be the Chairman;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Secretary for Justice; and (Amended 50 of 1990 s. 2; 121 of 1997 s. 3)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: 7 members appointed by the Chief Executive of whom— (Amended 121 of 1997 s. 5)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: 1 shall be a barrister and 1 shall be a solicitor, each holding a practising certificate issued under the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159); and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: 3 shall be persons who are not, in the opinion of the Chief Executive, connected in any way with the practice of law. (Replaced 50 of 1990 s. 2. Amended 121 of 1997 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Before making an appointment under subsection (1)(c)(ii) the Chief Executive shall consult the Bar Council of the Hong Kong Bar Association regarding the appointment of a barrister and the Council of the Law Society of Hong Kong regarding the appointment of a solicitor. (Added 50 of 1990 s. 2. Amended 70 of 1991 s. 15; 121 of 1997 s. 5)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: When consulted under subsection (1A) the Bar Council of the Bar Association may recommend any barrister to the Chief Executive for appointment and the Council of the Law Society may so recommend any solicitor, but the Chief Executive may appoint a person other than a person so recommended. (Added 50 of 1990 s. 2. Amended 70 of 1991 s. 15; 121 of 1997 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may resign his office by notice in writing to the Chief Executive; (Amended 121 of 1997 s. 5)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall vacate his office after 2 years, but shall be eligible for re-appointment.

subsection.content: The Chairman and no fewer than 6 other members may exercise and perform any of the functions, powers and duties of the Commission. (Replaced 50 of 1990 s. 2)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: At a meeting of the Commission a resolution is effective if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where 7 members are present, at least 5 vote in favour;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where 8 members are present, at least 6 vote in favour; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where 9 members are present, at least 7 vote in favour. (Added 50 of 1990 s. 2)

subsection.content: The Commission may authorize the Chairman to exercise and perform, either generally or in any particular case, such of the functions, powers and duties of the Commission under this Ordinance as it may specify.

subsection.leadIn: A resolution of the Commission without a meeting—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be put to the vote of the members by circulating a draft of the resolution with a voting paper;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be voted on by a member by signing the voting paper and returning it to the Secretary of the Commission; and

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: where 7 members sign the voting paper, at least 5 votes are in favour;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: where 8 members sign the voting paper, at least 6 votes are in favour; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: where 9 members sign the voting paper, at least 7 votes are in favour. (Replaced 50 of 1990 s. 2)

subsection.name: 5A
subsection.content: Notwithstanding subsection (5), a resolution is not effective where any member notifies the Secretary, on the voting paper, that the resolution should be discussed at a meeting. (Added 50 of 1990 s. 2)

subsection.name: 5B
subsection.leadIn: Where the Commission is exercising its functions— (Amended 10 of 2005 s. 130)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the filling of vacancies in judicial offices under section 6(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the extension of the term of office of the Chief Justice under section 14 of the Hong Kong Court of Final Appeal Ordinance (Cap. 484),

subsection.continued: a member who is or may reasonably be regarded as a candidate for selection to fill any such vacancy or whose term of office is being considered for extension shall disclose whether or not, if he were to be selected or if the extension of his term of office were to be recommended as the case may be, he is willing to accept appointment or the extension and that disclosure shall be recorded in the minutes of the Commission. (Added 79 of 1995 s. 50. Amended 10 of 2005 s. 130)

subsection.name: 5C
subsection.leadIn: A member who, under subsection (5B), discloses a willingness to accept an appointment or extension—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall not take part in any deliberation of the Commission with respect to that appointment or extension as the case may be and shall not vote on any question concerning the same; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall, for the purposes of subsection (6), with respect to any deliberation of the Commission concerning that appointment or extension as the case may be and any question concerning the same, be treated as being unable to act. (Added 79 of 1995 s. 50)

subsection.name: 5D
subsection.content: For the purposes of any meeting of the Commission, if the Chief Justice is unable to act as Chairman, those members present at that meeting may by resolution appoint any of their number to act in his place and in so acting to exercise and perform all the functions of the Chairman at that meeting. (Added 79 of 1995 s. 50)
If any appointed member is absent from Hong Kong or is unable to act, the Chief Executive may appoint another person to act temporarily as a member. (Amended 121 of 1997 s. 5)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Certain persons ineligible for appointment as members of the Commission

subsection.leadIn: A person shall not be appointed to be a member of the Commission if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: he is a member of the Legislative Council; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: he holds a pensionable office (other than the office of judge) the emoluments whereof are payable wholly or partly out of public revenue, unless he is on leave prior to retirement and has already received official notification of the pension which will be payable to him for service which comprised service in the office or post of which he is the holder. (Amended 92 of 1975 s. 59; 50 of 1990 s. 3; 121 of 1997 s. 4; 78 of 1999 s. 7)

subsection.content: The Chief Executive shall appoint a public officer to act as Secretary to the Commission. (Amended 121 of 1997 s. 5)
The Secretary shall not be a member of the Commission.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Functions of Commission
section.leadIn: The Commission shall advise or make recommendations to the Chief Executive regarding— (Amended 79 of 1995 s. 50)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the filling of vacancies in judicial offices;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: such representations from a judicial officer concerning conditions of service as may be referred to it by the Chief Executive;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any matter affecting judicial officers which may be prescribed or which the Chief Executive may refer to the Commission.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Oath of Chairman and members
section.content: Members appointed under section 3(1) or appointed temporarily under section 3(6) shall on first appointment take an oath or make an affirmation in the form in the Schedule 2, which shall be administered by a judge or a commissioner for oaths.

subsection.content: Notwithstanding section 7, a member appointed under section 3 and whose appointment takes effect on 1 July 1997 may take his oath or affirmation in the manner prescribed in section 7 as soon as practicable after the appointment.

For the avoidance of doubt, any advice given or recommendations made shall not be invalid merely by reason of the fact that the members of the Commission had not taken the relevant oaths or affirmations as prescribed under subsection (1).

section.name: s8
section.heading: Offence of giving false information to Commission
section.content: Any person who, in connexion with any matter on which it is the duty of the Commission to advise the Chief Executive under this Ordinance, wilfully gives to the Commission or a member thereof any information which is false in a material particular shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Reports and statements or other communications of Commission privileged
section.content: Any report, statement or other communication which the Commission may in the exercise of its functions or the discharge of its duties make to the Chief Executive or to the Chief Justice shall be privileged in that its production may not be compelled in any legal proceedings.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Protection to members
section.content: A member of the Commission shall have the same protection and privileges in proceedings brought against him for any act done in the execution of his duty as such member as a judge has when acting in the execution of his office.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Publication and disclose of information to unauthorized persons prohibited

subsection.content: Any member of the Commission or other person who, without the permission of the Chief Executive, publishes or discloses to any unauthorized person or otherwise than in the course of duty the contents or any part of the contents of any document, communication or information whatsoever which has come to his knowledge in the course of his duties under or in connexion with this Ordinance shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and to imprisonment for 1 year. (Amended 121 of 1997 s. 5)

If any person having any information which to his knowledge has been disclosed in contravention of this section publishes or discloses such information to any other person otherwise than for the purpose of any prosecution under this Ordinance, he shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 1 and to imprisonment for 1 year.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Offence to influence or attempt to influence Commission
section.leadIn: Any person who otherwise than in the course of his duty directly or indirectly by himself or by any other person in any manner whatsoever influences or attempts to influence a decision of the Commission or any member shall be guilty of an offence and shall be liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 2 years:

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that this section shall not prohibit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person from giving a certificate or testimonial to any applicant or candidate for appointment as a judicial officer or from supplying any information or assistance on request made by the Commission; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any judicial officer from making representations to the Commission in such manner and to such extent as may be prescribed. (Amended 50 of 1990 s. 4)

section.name: s13
section.heading: Power of Chief Executive in Council to make regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may by regulation provide for— (Amended 121 of 1997 s. 5)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the discharge by the Commission of additional functions;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time, place and manner of the exercise by the Commission of its functions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: forms and fees in connexion with applications to the Commission, reports or communications from the Commission or any other matter required by or under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any matter which is to be or may be prescribed.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Amendment of Schedule 1
section.content: The Legislative Council may by resolution amend Schedule 1.
